spim_buf_t Struct Reference

This structure contains parameters that describe an SPIM operation.

Data Fields

  • IMG_UINT8 * pui8Buffer
  • IMG_UINT32 ui32Size
  • IMG_INT32 i32Read
  • IMG_INT32 i32Cont
  • IMG_INT32 i32InterByteDelay
  • SPIM_eDevice eChipSelect
  • IMG_UINT8 ui8CmpValue
  • IMG_UINT8 ui8CmpMask
  • IMG_INT iCmpEq
  • IMG_INT32 i32CmpData

Field Documentation

IMG_UINT8* spim_buf_t::pui8Buffer

The buffer to read from or write to.
Set by the user for a standard operation.
Not used for a compare operation.

IMG_UINT32 spim_buf_t::ui32Size

Number of bytes to read/write. Valid range is 0 to 65536 bytes.
Note that a given size of 0 will transfer a maximum size of 65536 bytes.
Set by the user for a standard operation.
Used but not set by the user for a compare operation.

IMG_INT32 spim_buf_t::i32Read

Read/write select. TRUE for read, FALSE for write, Others - invalid.
Set by the user for a standard operation.
Used but not set by the user for a compare operation.

IMG_INT32 spim_buf_t::i32Cont

Continue select.
(Selects whether or not chip select is kept active after the operation).
0 - Non-continous, 1 - Continuous, Others - invalid.
Set by the user for a standard operation.
Set by the user for a compare operation.

IMG_INT32 spim_buf_t::i32InterByteDelay

ByteDelay select.
(Selects whether or not a delay is inserted between bytes).
0 - Minimum inter-byte delay 1 - Inter-byte delay of (cs_hold value / master_clk half period) * master_clk. Note that this is only applicable for bytes within a transaction if the continue bit is set at the end of the transaction. (refer spi_reg3[29] description in SPI Master TRM)

SPIM_eDevice spim_buf_t::eChipSelect

Chip select line (which slave to address).
Set by the user for a standard operation.
Set by the user for a compare operation.

IMG_UINT8 spim_buf_t::ui8CmpValue

Value to compare with incoming data when 'Compare Data' is used.
Not used for a standard operation.
Set by the user for a compare operation.

IMG_UINT8 spim_buf_t::ui8CmpMask

Compare data mask. Applied to both the received byte and cmpValue for comparison.
Not used for a standard operation.
Set by the user for a compare operation.

IMG_INT spim_buf_t::iCmpEq

Compare data equal/not equal select:
1 - Flag set when incoming data is equal to compare data value.
0 - Flag set when incoming data is not equal to compare data value.
Others - invalid.
Not used for a standard operation.
Set by the user for a compare operation.

IMG_INT32 spim_buf_t::i32CmpData

Private.
Used but not set by the user for a standard operation.
Used but not set by the user for a compare operation.
